text: not. 11.84 The site allocations set out required infrastructure that must be delivered to make a development acceptable, and part 1(b) emphasises that the delivery of this infrastructure, including sustainable transport improvements, should be focused on the earlier phases of delivery where possible. It is accepted that not all infrastructure will be able to come forward at the very start of development, but there should be a general principle that the delivery of infrastructure is front-loaded to ensure that the needs of the community will be met as new residents move into a development.
